PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A work of imagination to the pioneer

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because some of the questions here will not apply to every experience; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If there is not sufficient space to answer the question, write in the margin or on separate sheets.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1925, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or supply for a separate questionnaire.

Distrib Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did Eastern Canadian Pioneers Have?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please get a check here.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Check off those you listed below. Please mark this case you would be willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,

Saskatoon, Sask.
